result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Steward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Justice Point Pretrial report dated 09-29-2016

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  Shantel S-R.

Defendant sentenced to serve TWENTY-SEVEN (27) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for TWENTY-SEVEN (27) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

16RM047161  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09/02/16

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Conference proceeded on the Record.  State advised that Defendant has been in Warrant Status since 11-16-2015.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Anthony Steward in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 01:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer for Terese M. Dick.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Due to JusticePoint violations,  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report dated 10-27-2015.  Filed, sdg.
Turnover to JusticePoint upon release.  sdg

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Anthony Steward in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State reports that without negative UA's revocation will be considered.  Defendant also needs to complete Community Service.  Defendant has supplied documentation to JusticePoint.  Defendant has not currently been accepted into a Residential facility.  Matter is adjourned for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Dated 10-12-2015.  Filed, sdg.
Court remands Defendant into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending placement.  IF ADMITTED INTO TREATMENT, Court sets Bail at $250.00 PR with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Anthony Steward in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State requests that Bail be raised to $5,000.00 CASH.  Defense objects.  Court sets Bail at $2,000.00 Cash, turnover to Justice Point.

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  State requests that the Court take the Defendant into custody, raise bail and to not be released unless admitted into treatment.  Alternatively, the Defendant can revoke himself from the DPA and proceed to Sentencing.  Defendant reports he will go into custody.  Defense reports that she has spoken to Defendant's case manager and will contact him again after today's hearing.  The case manager reports that the wait list for treatment will be 2 (TWO) weeks to a month.  Review hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. sdg
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Non-Compliance report, received and filed. sdg

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has tested negative.  Defendant missed JP contact and Thinking For A Change.  Defendant to report to JP after court.  Defendant needs to complete community service.

  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court reviewed the report.  Defendant attended 4 of 7 contacts at JP and is testing positive.  Defendant will be beginning Thinking For A Change and will begin community service at a local church.  Review hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing.


  Review hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial report dated 03-02-2015

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is scheduled for TAD evaluation on 3/11/15.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Milwaukee Count Pretrial Services violation report dated 02-06-2015
Justice Point.

Defendant Anthony Steward in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant eligible for DPA.  Need a TAD evaluation.  Stipulation for agreed upon request for a new court date signed and filed.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
